metadata.title: CVE-2017-13704 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
In dnsmasq before 2.78, if the DNS packet size does not match the expectedsize, the size parameter in a memset call gets a negative value. As it isan unsigned value, memset ends up writing up to 0xffffffff zero's(0xffffffffffffffff in 64 bit platforms), making dnsmasq crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-13704` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dnsmasq - 2.75-1ubuntu0.16.04.2
dnsmasq-base - 2.75-1ubuntu0.16.04.2
dnsmasq-utils - 2.75-1ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dnsmasq package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.75-1ubuntu0.16.04.2').
